DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Ineligibility Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation that describes the clinical study population subgroup consent ineligibility reason.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Ineligibility Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies._Permission to do something._The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Ineligibility
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.:Permission to do something.:The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.
Permission to do something.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The explanation of why a participant is declared unable to participate in a clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanism for guarding against financial aspects of risk by making payments in the form of premiums to an insurance company, which pays an agreed-upon sum to the insured in the event of loss.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options: Concerning or related to monetary conditions.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: A mechanism for guarding against financial aspects of risk by making payments in the form of premiums to an insurance company, which pays an agreed-upon sum to the insured in the event of loss.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Concerning or related to monetary conditions.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Methods of traveling from one place to another.: A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Methods of traveling from one place to another.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.: Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Psychological And Social Condition Block Trial Compliance
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with how the mind works and how thoughts and feelings affect behavior.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Relating to human society and its members.: A state of being, such as a state of health.: Interrupt the normal function of; hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of; stop from happening or developing; interfere with or prevent the reception of signals; impede the movement of.: Adherence to clinical trial-related requirements, good clinical practice (GCP) requirements, and the applicable regulatory requirements. (ICH)

Interrupt the normal function of; hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of; stop from happening or developing; interfere with or prevent the reception of signals; impede the movement of.
Adherence to clinical trial-related requirements, good clinical practice (GCP) requirements, and the applicable regulatory requirements. (ICH)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Child Less Than 8 Years Old at Time of Enrollment
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subject who, according to the law of the applicable jurisdiction concerned, is under the age of legal competence to give informed consent. [after EU CTR]: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::8: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A subject who, according to the law of the applicable jurisdiction concerned, is under the age of legal competence to give informed consent. [after EU CTR]
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.: A lack of occurrence or performance.

Concepts.definition: Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
A lack of occurrence or performance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The measurement of the size of a tumor mass either clinically or in a surgically resected specimen.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: The measurement of the size of a tumor mass either clinically or in a surgically resected specimen.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance that may be found in tumor tissue or released from a tumor into the blood or other body fluids. A high level of a tumor marker may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (in ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (in breast cancer), CEA (in ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (in prostate cancer).: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
Alternative choices or actions.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Adverse Event Or Serious Adverse Event Onset

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adverse Event Or Serious Adverse Event Onset
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product o procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.: The start, beginning, or early stages. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.
The start, beginning, or early stages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The reemergence of neoplasm after a period of remission: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.                           : The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. : Required; necessary, not optional.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

Concepts.definition: When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.
